title: Embed Training Heat Map into Training Statistics card and remove debug UI

requirements.summary: Render the existing Training Heat Map inside the Training Statistics card directly beneath the 6 metric tiles, and remove the standalone section below the cards while preserving all heat map behavior and sizing.
acceptanceCriteria: On the Profile Analytics tab, the Training Heat Map is rendered within the "Training Statistics" card, beneath the 6 metric tiles.
The Training Heat Map no longer appears as a separate section outside/below the statistics card.
Heat map behavior is unchanged: year navigation (prev/next + dropdown), day selection, legend, theme-aware coloring updates, and loading state work as they did previously.
Heat map sizing is unchanged: day cells remain 12px squares (`w-3 h-3`), and the grid retains its current overflow/scroll behavior.

file_operations.description: Add an embedded/in-card rendering mode so the heat map can be placed inside an existing parent card (Training Statistics) without introducing a nested standalone card section, while keeping the same year selector, legend, totals, theme-aware coloring recalculation, loading state, and the same grid sizing (`w-3 h-3`) and scroll/overflow behavior for the heat map container.

Move the TrainingHeatMap rendering into the "Training Statistics" CardContent directly under the 6 metric tiles (using the heat mapâ€™s embedded/in-card mode), and remove the standalone "Training Heat Map" section that currently renders below the profile/statistics cards.

requirements.summary: Remove all user-facing bug/debug UI controls and ensure the debug overlay is never rendered across any app state.
acceptanceCriteria: There is no Bug icon button in the header and no user-facing control labeled or intended for debug mode.
The debug overlay is not rendered anywhere in the application UI across all authentication/initialization states.
App functionality unrelated to debug UI (login, profile setup, dashboard navigation) continues to work without requiring debug-mode localStorage flags or page reloads.

file_operations.description: Remove the Bug icon import and the debug toggle button/handler so no debug-mode toggle is exposed in the header UI.

Remove DebugOverlay import and stop rendering the debug overlay in all app states (initializing, login, actor-connecting, profile-loading, profile-setup, loaded, fallback) so the overlay never appears.
Delete the debug overlay component implementation to fully remove the user-facing debug panel from the codebase (ensuring no remaining imports/usages exist after App.tsx is updated).
